item.title: There was a significant increase in early-stage M&A activity in the APAC region during the fourth quarter of 2016
item.description: The Intralinks Deal Flow Predictor, which forecasts future merger and acquisition (M&A) announcements, anticipates a 6% rise in the total number of global M&A deals announced in the first half of 2017 compared to the same period in 2016. This would establish a new record for global announced deals in the first six months of a year. The Asia Pacific (APAC) region leads in early-stage M&A activity, demonstrating 44% year-over-year growth in the fourth quarter of 2016, and is positioned to significantly contribute to the projected record deal count in the first half of 2017.
